result.execSummary:
The defendant Najai Taladine Robinson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse programs.
Concurrent with: Case 22CM1 and any sentence now serving

superMiscConds.notes:
AODA assessment/treatment and follow through 
COMPAS Evaluation and follow through 
Complete psychological evaluation
Submit DNA Sample when defendant reports to jail.

Defendant Najai Taladine Robinson in court with attorney Aleksandra Hodowany.  Defendant Najai Taladine Robinson in custody.  Assistant District Attorney Joshua Dryak appears on behalf of the State.  Present bond continued  Plea hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Najai Taladine Robinson appears with attorney Aleksandra Hodowany via zoom.  Defendant Najai Taladine Robinson in custody @ BCJ.  Asst. District Attorney John Luetscher appears on behalf of the State. Still needs dicovery. Def Waives In-Person Appearance.  Reading of the information waived and NG pleas entered to all counts. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
